page.title: 02FARMING MILK AND CROPS
page.content: {BARNTON AND LITTLE LEIGH 03600375} FARMING 1 Of the farms covered, all but one are dairy farms.The odd one, Stoneleigh House Farm is a 2.69 acre pig farm.In addition to milking stock and heifers 1/3 grow potatoes, and cereals for cattle feed.The 9.75sq.km. area devoted to farming is highly fertile and suitable for dairy cattle mostly Friesian stock.Each cow produces between l5 and l6 litres of milk per day.Farms produce silage for cattle feed and supplement it with carefully monitored quantities of cereal, vitamins and minerals to ensure high milk yield.Modern milking parlours are a feature enabling quick and efficient extraction of milk. Mechanical equipment makes farming less physically demanding, although working hours are long.
